label: AB_cI16_217_c_c-001
title: Theoretical cI16 AlN Structure
comments:
AlN naturally occurs in two forms (Liu, 2019): the stable wz-AlN \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_hP4_186_b_b-001}{wurtzite ($B4$) structure}, and the high-pressure rs-AlN \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cF8_225_a_b-001}{rock salt ($B1$) structure}.  A metastable zb-AlN \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cF8_216_a_c-001}{zincblende ($B3$) structure} can be synthesized via a solid-state reaction. 
 (Liu, 2019) used a first-principles evolutionary technique to find four possible metastable phases: one in the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cP16_205_c_c-001}{sc16 structure}, and three novel cubic structures, \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cF40_216_ae_be-001}{cF40}, \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cI16_217_c_c-001}{cI16} (this structure), and \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cI24_220_a_b-001}{cI24}.
